Group Product Manager, Productivity

at Slack in Remote, US from 2/21/2021

Weâ€™re looking for someone who can take an audacious goal in a broad field of productivity and devise a vision, strategy, and plan they will execute in collaboration with their design, engineering, and research partners.The role requires someone comfortable with operating in a highly dynamic environment, who thrives on navigating ambiguity and solving complex problems. The product manager is the glue between engineering, design, and both internal and external stakeholders.

Responsibilities

Responsible for the 1~2 year product vision and strategy for how teams and individuals better prioritize, organize, and get their work done.
Relied upon by senior leadership as a domain expert in the field of productivity, often presenting to executives your product strategy, execution progress, and contribution to company-wide success metrics.
You will not have a team to manage directly, but will lead a cross-functional team.
Help cross-functional partners, and senior leaders to be aware of down-stream risks and dependencies to be mitigated.
Synthesize customer needs, industry trends, and data to think deeply to create strategies and plans to take us into white-space territory.
Comfortable learning quickly, prototyping rapidly, and shipping incrementally as you discover and find product-market fit.

Skills

A senior technical product leader with a pragmatic, strategic approach to problem-solving with a strong product intuition.
A customer-centric and have demonstrated examples of successfully delivering compelling user features in the productivity space.
An execution-focused mindset and can appropriately prioritize and manage conflicting requirements.
A proven ability to establish credibility at the executive level and have experience gaining consensus and approval for product planning efforts across multiple functional leaders.
A genuine self-starter who proactively identifies challenges/opportunities and works across teams and organizations to generate and execute solutions.
Strong technically and have a track record of successfully delivering innovative solutions resulting in rapid adoption by users.
Approach complex challenges methodically, building decision making frameworks founded on qualitative and quantitative data.
A university degree (BS or MS) in Computer Science, a related degree or equivalent experience is recommended
8+ years of product management experience
Strong written/verbal communication skills

Preferred Qualifications

3+ years of developer or designer experience.
Productivity software experience in user-facing products strongly preferred.
Passion about Slack and the problems we are solving.
